intro: Gongronema napalense var. sagittatum, commonly known as the arrowleaf gongronema, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves, which are typically arranged oppositely along the stem. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
